title: How to use groupStatModule
text: soroban’s groupStatModule performs Aggregation. article, ’ll use scholarship dataset datatoys article based 0.0.1 Version soroban

title: How to use groupStatModule
text: soroban’s module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let’s add treeModule ui. also, treeModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_groupStatModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_groupStatModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_groupStatModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_groupStatModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # Run application

title: How to use groupStatModule
text: groupStatModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) Select group summary metric. build

title: How to use groupStatModule
text: Using scholarship, ’ll see summary metric catetory university. Set group 학제별 summary mean.  result shows . university category 대학 (university), average scholarship (교외장학금) near 13.9 Billion. university category 전문대학 (college), average scholarship near 6.8 Billion. (almost X2) groupStatModule supports multiple group. 학제별, options can choose. issue suggestion, please make issue soroban’s github.

title: How to use kmsModule
text: soroban’s kmsModule generates k-means cluster. article, ’ll use USArrests dataset datasets, can just use data("USArrests") article based 0.0.1 Version soroban

title: How to use kmsModule
text: soroban’s module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let’s add treeModule ui. also, treeModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_kmsModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_kmsModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datasets::USArrests)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_kmsModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_kmsModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datasets::USArrests)   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # Run application

title: How to use kmsModule
text: treeModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) select K build Cluster data different scale (normalized), check scale. data label (name), can select Labels-Opt

title: How to use kmsModule
text: Using USArrests, ’ll group city similarity. Set K 4  issue suggestion, please make issue soroban’s github.

title: How to use mlrModule
text: soroban’s mlrModule perform Multiple Linear Regression analysis shows linear model & variable importance. article, ’ll use marketing dataset datarium article based 0.0.1 Version soroban datarium::marketing

title: How to use mlrModule
text: soroban’s module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let’s add pcaModule ui. also, pcaModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_mlrModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_mlrModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datarium::marketing)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_mlrModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_mlrModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datarium::marketing) # remotes::install_github('kassambara/datarium')   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # Run application

title: How to use mlrModule
text: pcaModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) select explain, response variables Reg (Regression !)

title: How to use mlrModule
text: Using marketing, ’ll see factor makes sales. Select facebook, newspaper, youtube X sales Y  can see variable importance left, (means Youtube effect sales Facebook) model right panel ( \(sales \approx 0.1878 \times facebook + 0.045 \times youtube + 3.505\) ) Note , mlrModule automatically select model AIC (stepwise) newspaper removed process (may small effect sales) issue suggestion, please make issue soroban’s github.

title: How to use pcaModule
text: soroban’s pcaModule perform pca analysis generates Biplot. article, ’ll use scholarship dataset datatoys article based 0.0.1 Version soroban

title: How to use pcaModule
text: soroban’s module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let’s add pcaModule ui. also, pcaModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_pcaModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_pcaModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_pcaModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_pcaModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship) # remotes::install_github('statgarten/datatoys')   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # Run application

title: How to use pcaModule
text: pcaModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) select variable analysis. (data different scale, check normalize) 2-1. (Optional) adjust plot’s height (consider modify UI version) Draw

title: How to use pcaModule
text: Using scholarship, ’ll see factor makes university differ. However, change data’s type first. since PCA module requires options types. change 학제별 factor. category University College. fill variables like image; mean type scholarship. (sum schoar removed)  (대학명 means name university, used Label (optional)) result shown.  note university shows like outlier, means provide scholarships student. (like Seoul Univ.)  move / zoom figure (uses plotly can use interactive feature), can see many types scholarship provided forward Red university Blue college. issue suggestion, please make issue soroban’s github.

title: How to use treeModule
text: soroban’s treeModule generates Decision tree. article, ’ll use TeachingRatings dataset AER article based 0.0.1 Version soroban

title: How to use treeModule
text: soroban’s module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let’s add treeModule ui. also, treeModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_treeModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_treeModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(TeachingRatings)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_treeModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_treeModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(TeachingRatings)   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: How to use treeModule
text: treeModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) select variable generate tree. 2-1. (Optional) adjust tree layout option like Edge Node, Terminal tree build Tree

title: How to use treeModule
text: Using TeachingRatings, ’ll see factor effects teacher’s evaluation. Set X beauty, minority, age ,gender,division,native,tenure (order important) Y eval. want model Evaluation 7 factors Also, treeModule supports regression . select nodePlot options beauty, gender, minority (typo fixed version)  Tree, generated tree shown.  Result shows , beauty factor’s effect teacher evaluation. scatter plot regression relation beauty eval based gender. (consider change nodePlot option may required version) However change character type value factor, (accurate) result also changed. issue suggestion, please make issue soroban’s github.
